channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023110148
item.description:
Report X-2023110148

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-29T18:13:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-12
  • City: KOKOMO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED OFF OF TRAILER, TOP OF PACKAGE AND TWO SIDES WERE WET. REMOVED FORM ROLLERS AND PLACED INSIDE RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: CAP ON BOTTLE DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE REMOVED FROM ROLLERS AND PLACED INSIDE TOTE, PKG OPENED UP AND TIGHTENED LEAKING CAP.

item.title: Report E-2023110099
item.description:
Report E-2023110099

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 5-gallon spill of UN1263 "Etching Primer Yellow" from a 5-gallon metal pail caused by a forklift puncture and impacting their dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller who confirmed that terminal staff were comfortable cleaning the spill with proper PPE and ventilation. (1) 10-gallon DM containing 1 5-gallon metal pail of Etching Primer Yellow and Oil Dri of waste was created and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110094
item.description:
Report X-2023110094

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED, PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET AND FAILED DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. 4 X 1 GALLON BOTTLES OF CORROSIVE LIQUIDS LEAKED OUT OF BOTTLES ONTO PACKAGE CAUSING ENTIRE PACKAGE TO FAIL. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2023110105
item.description:
Report E-2023110105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-15
  • City: COLUMBIA CITY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While offloading, the driver noticed there was liquid spilling because of the tank overfilling. The product was being delivered into a remote fill and a previous carrier's driver had left the lid uncovered causing the spill.
